headline: Supervisory Industrial Hygeinist at U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)
summary: An accredited environmental health professional with proven analytical, communications, and leadership skills in government safety management, private consulting, and military service looking to expand into government public policy and management.  Wide background in many aspects of environmental health, including but not limited to: indoor air quality, occupational health and safety, food safety and general sanitation, industrial hygiene, environmental sampling, community outreach, and laboratory safety.

positions.description:
Staff senior Senior Industrial Hygienist.
Assumed the role of primary program manager for Personal Protective Equipment (PPE), Indoor Air Quality Management, Ergonomics, Hazardous Material Control and Management, Laboratory Hygiene, Medical Surveillance, Respiratory Protection, and the Mishap Prevention, Investigation and Reporting Practices Programs.
Provided chemical hygiene management policy and best practices that included hazardous chemical replacement information and HAZCOM that included options to reduce the environmental impact and reduce human health risks associated with Naval Research Laboratory (NRL) research.  
Surveyed multi-purpose areas of NRL that included a general office, supply and laboratory areas for safety and health issues.  Completed required paperwork to resolve deficiencies found during inspections.
Performed surveys and inspections relating to occupant complaints of work place hazards (i.e. fungal contamination, unsafe facility conditions).  Provided recommendations for risk management and followed up on progress of hazard abatement.  
Investigated reports of injury and ânear missâ situations and provided after action reports to reduce risk following reportable and recordable situations. 
Professional training includes Department of Navy, Naval Safety and Environmental Training Center Respiratory Protection Program Management Course A-493-0072- May 2012,  Mishap Investigation (Ashore) Course A-493-0078 â February 2012, and Introduction to Hazardous Materials Ashore Course A-493-0331 â November 2013.

positions.description:
Served as Navigation Information Specialist/Editor assisting the public with navigational subjects.
Maintained and published list of all aids to navigation and possible discrepancies around the US on a weekly and annual basis and worked with other Coast Guard districts to disseminate published information.
Held position of Coast Guard Headquarters worldwide navigation chart portfolio custodian.
Served on three Coast Guard Cutters as Assistant Navigator, Quartermaster of the Watch, and law enforcement petty officer.
As operations leading petty officer trained watch standers, held a top secret clearance and was a classified material custodian.
